# IntelliTrust Administration API documentation
This document describes how to manage your IntelliTrust account using Administration (Admin) API calls. This API allows you to seamlessly perform administrative actions on IntelliTrust without logging in to the IntelliTrust Administrator portal.
# Prerequisites
Confirm the following before executing the Admin API calls included in this guide:
 - An Admin API application has been created on your IntelliTrust account. The application must be configured with a role that has the permissions needed by your application. IntelliTrust allows you to download a JSON file once the application is created.
 - The Application ID and Shared Secret parameter values are easily accessible. They must be entered into the body of the Admin APi request. The required values are displayed after creating the Administration API application on IntelliTrust. Upon creation, you can either copy these values to your clipboard or download them as a JSON file.
 - The Admin API application configuration data has been downloaded and is available for use.

# IntelliTrust Administration APIs
IntelliTrust administration APIs are grouped into the following categories. You can only perform the API calls permitted by the role assigned to your Administration API application on IntelliTrust. See the **IntelliTrust Administrator Help** for more information on IntelliTrust roles:
 ### Admin Authentication
These APIs facilitate authentication between your Admin API application and IntelliTrust. You must make this call before making any other Admin API calls. The call generates an authentication token value that must be included in all other Admin API requests.

The Admin API authentication response includes the token's expiration time. For instance:
```
    "authToken": "",
    "expirationTime": "2020-01-23T16:30:58Z",
    "creationTime": "2020-01-23T16:15:58Z"
}
```
If you use this authentication token to make requests after it expires, the service will return an UNAUTHORIZED response code (401) and you will need to reauthenticate to obtain a new token.

Some workarounds to prevent this are:
- Always reauthenticate before making a request; or
- Track the expiration time and reauthenticate when you detect that it has expired; or
- Send an OPTIONS request to the same end-point to detect whether the token has expired. This can be useful with end-points receiving a large payload such as images where the token can expire before the request has completed. In these cases the request may fail with a 500 error.

When an admin API application authenticates, there is an option to enable a web session to add additional security to the session.  This is done by setting the enableWebSession argument passed to the authentication controller to true.  When a web session is enabled, a HTTP session cookie named INTELLITRUST_SESSION_ID will be returned with the authentication results.  This cookie must be included with all subsequent admin API calls along with the authentication token.
 ### Users 
These APIs facilitate user management operations on an IntelliTrust account.
 ### Smart Credentials
The Entrust Datacard® Mobile Smart Credential (MSC) application allows users to perform authentications to their IntelliTrust account and configured applications. This API call facilitates mobile smart credential management operations on an IntelliTrust account.
 ### Tokens
These APIs facilitate hardware and soft token management operations on an IntelliTrust account.
 ### FIDO2 Tokens
 These APIs faciliate management of FIDO2 tokens.  FIDO2 tokens cannot be registered using the administration API but they can be viewed, deleted and updated.
 ### Grid Cards
 Grid authentication uses cards with a grid as the authentication lookup tool. This API call facilitates Grid Card management operations on an IntelliTrust account.
 ### Temporary Access Codes
Temporary Access Codes can be used to log in when a user cannot access their one-time passcode (OTP), Grid Card, or token authenticator. This API call facilitates Temporary Access Code management operations on an IntelliTrust account.
 ### KBA - Knowledge-based Authenticators
Knowledge-based authentication (or knowledge-based authenticators) (KBA) (also known as question-and-answer (Q&A) authentication) allows users to authenticate to SAML application accounts using IntelliTrust by providing the correct answer to one or more preregistered questions. This API call facilitates Knowledge-based Authenticator management operations on an IntelliTrust account.
 ### Passwords
There are two types of password authenticators available on IntelliTrust —IntelliTrust passwords and Active Directory (AD) passwords. IntelliTrust passwords are passwords that can be manually or automatically assigned to users on IntelliTrust. Active Directory (AD) passwords are passwords that have already been assigned to a user on their corporate directory - not through IntelliTrust. This API call facilitates password management operations on an IntelliTrust account for either type of password.
 ### User Risk-based authentication (RBA) Settings
 Risk-based authentication (RBA) identifies the level of risk associated with a user who tries to authenticate. This API call facilitates Risk-based authentication management operations on an IntelliTrust account.
 ### Machine authenticators
Machine Authentication (MA) provides identification information on the Web browser being used to access a SAML application. This API call facilitates Machine Authenticator management operations on an IntelliTrust account. 
 ### User Attributes
User attributes are the information fields listed as part of each user's Profile information. This API call facilitates user attribute management operations on an IntelliTrust account. 
 ### Roles
Roles control what operations a user can perform on their IntelliTrust account. These roles distinguish the amount of access given to each account, ranging from administrators with full access to end users (who can only access the user portal features).This API call facilitates role management operations on an IntelliTrust account.
 ### Groups
An IntelliTrust group is a collection of users given access to applications based on the resource rules they are assigned to. This API call facilitates group management operations on an IntelliTrust account.
 ### Reports
These APIs allows you to access the Audit Log on your IntelliTrust account. This Log lists the actions performed on your account within a period of time.
 ### Settings
 These APIs provide management of the settings used to configure IntelliTrust behavior.  Settings that can be managed using the administration API include General settings, OTP settings and Token settings.
 ### Applications
 These APIs provide management of authentication API applications using the administration API.
 ### Resource Rules
 Resource rules define what authenticators are required to authenticate to an application.  The resource rules APIs provide management of resource rules using the administration API.
 ### Directories
 These APIs provide directory related information using the administration API.
 ### Tenants
 For service provider accounts, the tenant APIs provide management of their child tenants as well as mangement of entitlements for those tenants. These APIs are only available for accounts that are service providers.
 ### Account Info
 The account info APIs provide functionality to fetch and modify account related information such as the company name and the license acknowledged flag.
 ### ActiveSync Access
 These APIs facilitate management of Exchange ActiveSync Devices available on your Microsoft Office 365 account.
 ### ID Proofing
These APIs are used to validate the identity of a person by performing a liveness check using a government-issued identity document, such as a driver's license or a passport, and comparing the document photograph with a self-portrait digital photograph (selfie) taken on a mobile device.

# Examples
The following are examples of Admin API calls that can be used to perform administrative actions. The examples below are not an exhaustive list of possible Admin API actions. 

**Important:** You must execute the Authentication (Admin API) call before executing any other Admin API calls. The Authentication (Admin API) call generates a token value that must be included in every other request to be successful.

## Authentication (Admin API)
To perform this action, the first step is to submit a POST request to the Admin application. This is the Admin application created on your IntelliTrust account. The URL address of the Admin application includes your IntelliTrust account URL. The format of the URL is:  
```  
https://<domainname>.<region>.trustedauth.com/api/web/v1/adminapi/authenticate  
```  
For example:  
```  
https://example.us.trustedauth.com/api/web/v1/adminapi/authenticate  
```  
The body of this request should contain the JSON object with an Application ID and Shared Secret. This JSON file was generated during creation of Admin Application on IntelliTrust. For example:  
```  
{	"applicationId": "d3737e0f-4d8e-431c-b1d8-cd17ad4d633d","sharedSecret": "randomSharedSecret"}  
```
An API response is received if the call is successful . For example:
```
{
    "authToken": "",
    "expirationTime": "2018-05-28T19:07:50.328+0000",
    "creationTime": "2018-05-28T18:52:50.329+0000"
}
```
You must include the **auth token** value displayed in this response in subsequent API calls. Without it, other Admin API calls will fail.

An error code is displayed if the call is unsuccessful. A different error code is displayed for each type of error.
## Users
### Create A User
Submit a POST request to create a User on your account. 
The format of the URL is:  
```  
https://<domainname>.<region>.trustedauth.com/api/web/v2/users
```   
An Authorization header field must be included in the header section of this request. The Authorization header stores the value received as **token** in the authentication request. The body of this request must contain all the fields mentioned in the example below that are configured as mandatory: 
```
{
   "firstName":"john",
   "lastName":"smith",
   "email":"johnsmith@organization.com",
   "userId":"john",
   "mobile":"+16138561234",
   "phone":"+161385699876",
   "locale":"",
   "state":"ACTIVE",
   "externaId":null,
   "externalSource":null,
   "userAttributeValues":[
   ],
   "userAliases": [
      {
         "value": "johnny",
         "type": "CUSTOM"
      }
   ]   
}
```
In this example, all the required input parameters have been provided. The request would succeed and generate a response that includes all the details of the create user. For example:
```
{
    "id": "2c422a2f-e8ae-4af8-8b03-e1ce0ddde0b0",

    "externalId": null,
    "externalSource": null,
    "migrated": null,
    "locked": false,
    "lockoutExpiry": null,
    "otpCreateTime": null,
    "grids": [],
    "tokens": [
        {
            "id": "9a2edcc5-46f0-4fff-89b1-13c0f73e1a5c",
            "type": "ENTRUST_SOFT_TOKEN",
            "serialNumber": "62461-69384",

                "REACTIVATE",

        }
    ],

    "tempAccessCode": null,

        {
            "id": "43422a2f-e8ae-4af8-8b03-e1ce0ddde0b0",

            "value": "john",
            "type": "USERID"
        }
    ],
    "groups": [],
    "type": "MGMT_UI"
}
```
### Get a User by UserID
Submit a POST request to retrieve user details for a particular User Id. The format of the URL is:  
```  
https://<domainname>.<region>.trustedauth.com/api/web/v2/users/userid
```  
An Authorization header field must be included in the header section of this request. The Authorization header stores the value received as **token** in the authentication request. The body of this request must contain **UserID**. For example:
```
{"userId":"John"}
``` 
In this example, all the required input parameters have been provided. The request would succeed and generate a response that includes the user's information. For example:
```
{
    "id": "2c422a2f-e8ae-4af8-8b03-e1ce0ddde0b0",

        {
            "id": "9a2edcc5-46f0-4fff-89b1-13c0f73e1a5c",

        {
            "id": "2c422a2f-e8ae-4af8-8b03-e1ce0ddde0b0",

            "value": "john",
            "type": "USERID"
        }
    ],

    "type": "MGMT_UI"
}
```
## Grids
### Create a Grid
Submit a POST request to create a new Grid Card and assign it to a user. You must include the UUID of the user that you want to assign a Grid Card in the API request. The format of the URL is:  
```  
https://<domainname>.<region>.trustedauth.com/api/web/v1/users/{userid}/grids
``` 
For example:
```
https://example.us.trustedauth.com/api/web/v1/users/2c422a2f-e8ae-4af8-8b03-e1ce0ddde0b0/grids
```
An Authorization header field must be included in the header section of this request. The Authorization header stores the value received as **token** in the authentication request. 

In this example, all the required input parameters have been provided. The request would succeed and generate a response that includes the desired Grid Card information. For example:

### Get a Grid by Id
Submit a POST request to display a Grid Card's details. You must include the Grid Card's ID string in the request. The ID is required to identify which Grid Card's details to display. The format of the request URL is:  
```
https://customer.region.trustedauth.com/api/web/v1/users/grids/{gridid}
```
For example:
```
https://example.us.trustedauth.com/api/web/v1/users/grids/6c5ad3b4-888c-4d3b-88f2-8ab71ae4f917
```
An Authorization header field must be included in the header section of this request. The Authorization header stores the value received as "token" in the authentication request. 

In this example, all the required input parameters have been provided. The request would succeed and generate a response that includes Grid Card details. For example:

## ID Proofing
### Initiate an ID Proofing Transaction
Submit a POST request to initiate the transaction and obtain the mobile SDK license. You must include a device fingerprint in the request if the service is configured to require it. The format of the request URL is:  
```
https://customer.region.trustedauth.com/api/web/v1/idproofing/init
```
For example:
```
https://example.us.trustedauth.com/api/web/v1/idproofing/init
```
An Authorization header field must be included in the header section of this request. The Authorization header stores the value received as "token" in the authentication request: 
```
{
	"clientIp": "1.2.3.4",
	"firstPartyBlackbox": "0610Jy4JhpaIbhJOJAyOFS...CpysKGn9rI0cgfvRE="
}
```
> Checking the reputation of a device using a fingerprint is not supported in this release.
>
In this example, the request would succeed and generate a response that includes the license. For example:
```
{
    "requestId": "0ba70f09-58c8-4a8e-bb87-cf98f4f4c111",
    "deviceCheckResult": "ALLOW",
    "deviceCheckReason": "",
    "deviceCheckDetails": {
        "device.alias": "115993746090684075",
        "device.bb.age": "9756913",
        "device.bb.timestamp": "2019-09-24T13:56:53Z",
        "device.firstseen": "2019-09-19T14:01:06.004Z",
        "device.flash.storage.enabled": "0",
        "device.js.enabled": "0",
        "device.new": "0",
        "device.os": "IPHONE 12.4.1",
        "device.type": "IPHONE",
        ...
    },
    "subscriberId": "5f5edd7f-bf52-4c4e-6da3-56a278148bbe",
    "subscriberAccount": "example@company.com",
    "subscriberPassword": "xyz34@19fdjt&sw2",
    ...
}
```
Note the requestId attribute returned. This value must be used in the following interactions with the service.

If a fingerprint is provided (firstPartyBlackbox attribute in the request) and the deviceCheckResult attribute value is DENY, then the transaction cannot be continued.

### Upload the Front Side Image of a Document ID
Submit a PUT request to upload the front image of a supported document ID. The format of the request URL is:  
```
https://customer.region.trustedauth.com/api/web/v1/idproofing/<requestId>/image/0
```
For example:
```
https://example.us.trustedauth.com/api/web/v1/idproofing/a63b0b66-1d1d-4834-b393-38a52c5e8304/image/0
```
An Authorization header field must be included in the header section of this request. The Authorization header stores the value received as "token" in the authentication request. 

The binary image must be submitted in the body of the HTTP request.
> If the authentication token has expired and the image is very large, the response sometimes can be a generic Internal Error (500) instead of UNAUTHORIZED (401).  To prevent this, it's recommended to submit an OPTIONS request before submitting the PUT request with the image.  The OPTIONS request will always return UNAUTHORIZED (401) if the authentication token is expired.
>

In this example, the image is successfully classified into a well-known document class. For example:
```
{
    "presentationChanged": false,
    "documentClass": "DRIVERSLICENSE",
    "countryCode": "USA",
    "supportedFrontImage": true,
    "supportedBackImage": true
}
```
If the documentClass attribute value is UNKNOWN, then you need to upload a better image to continue.

### Upload the Back Side Image of a Document ID
If the response after submitting a valid Front image includes the "supportedBackImage" attribute with value "true", then you can submit a PUT request to upload the back image of a supported document ID. The format of the request URL is:

Note that uploading the back of a document is optional as in some cases all the relevant information is available in the front of the document.  
```
https://customer.region.trustedauth.com/api/web/v1/idproofing/<requestId>/image/1
```
For example:
```
https://example.us.trustedauth.com/api/web/v1/idproofing/a63b0b66-1d1d-4834-b393-38a52c5e8304/image/1
```
An Authorization header field must be included in the header section of this request. The Authorization header stores the value received as "token" in the authentication request. 

The binary image must be submitted in the body of the HTTP request.
> If the authentication token has expired and the image is very large, the response sometimes can be a generic Internal Error (500) instead of UNAUTHORIZED (401).  To prevent this, it's recommended to submit an OPTIONS request before submitting the PUT request with the image.  The OPTIONS request will always return UNAUTHORIZED (401) if the authentication token is expired.
>
In this example, the image is successfully classified into a well-known document class. For example:
```
{
    "presentationChanged": false,
    "documentClass": "DRIVERSLICENSE",
    "countryCode": "USA",
    "supportedFrontImage": true,
    "supportedBackImage": true
}
```
If the documentClass attribute value is UNKNOWN, then you need to upload a better image to continue.

### Complete an ID Proofing Transaction using an Standard Facial Recognition License
If you are using an Standard Facial Recognition license and the document images uploaded in the previous requests classified correctly, you can now submit a PUT request to upload the selfie that the mobile SDK takes.
 
```
https://customer.region.trustedauth.com/api/web/v1/idproofing/<requestId>/completeselfie
```
For example:
```
https://example.us.trustedauth.com/api/web/v1/idproofing/a63b0b66-1d1d-4834-b393-38a52c5e8304/completeselfie
```
An Authorization header field must be included in the header section of this request. The Authorization header stores the value received as "token" in the authentication request. 
<p>
The binary selfie image must be submitted in the body of the HTTP request.

In this example, the selfie matches the document ID photo (faceMatch true) but document ID authentication indicates ATTENTION as one of the tests performed on the document didn't PASS--see documentTestResults:

This may also occur if a valid document is significantly worn or damaged or if the document is of a new or different type that is not yet supported by the library.  The document should be examined manually.",

```
    ]
}
```
### Complete an ID Proofing Transaction using an Enhanced Facial Recognition License
If you are using an Enhanced Facial Recognition license and the document images uploaded in the previous requests classified correctly, you can now submit a PUT request with the liveness test result that the mobile SDK provides.
 
```
https://customer.region.trustedauth.com/api/web/v1/idproofing/<requestId>/complete
```
For example:
```
https://example.us.trustedauth.com/api/web/v1/idproofing/a63b0b66-1d1d-4834-b393-38a52c5e8304/complete
```
An Authorization header field must be included in the header section of this request. The Authorization header stores the value received as "token" in the authentication request. 
```
{
  "livenessUserId" : "919ce7d3-1194-465d-9588-8668b8ac3bac",
  "livenessToken" : "31706131726336496d655177346e55503279616b69547344446e5258684c7542"
}
```

The response from this request is identical to the one you can see in the previous section.

post.summary: Lists a page of assigned grids
post.description:
Returns assigned grids for the provided search parameters. Caller requires the GRIDS:VIEW permission. The following searchByAttributes are supported:
  • serialNumber: a numeric value. Allowed operators are: EQUALS, GREATER_THAN, GREATER_THAN_OR_EQUAL, LESS_THAN, LESS_THAN_OR_EQUAL.
  • state: ACTIVE or INACTIVE. Allowed operator: EQUALS.
  • expired: 'true' is the only value allowed. Allowed operator: EQUALS.
  • createDate: a String value representing an ISO-8601 date in UTC time (e.g., 2018-08-04T18:15:30). Allowed operators are: GREATER_THAN, GREATER_THAN_OR_EQUAL, LESS_THAN, LESS_THAN_OR_EQUAL.
  • expiryDate: a String value representing an ISO-8601 date in UTC time (e.g., 2018-08-04T18:15:30). Allowed operators are: GREATER_THAN, GREATER_THAN_OR_EQUAL, LESS_THAN, LESS_THAN_OR_EQUAL.
  • lastUsedDate: a String value representing an ISO-8601 date in UTC time (e.g., 2018-08-04T18:15:30). Allowed operators are: GREATER_THAN, GREATER_THAN_OR_EQUAL, LESS_THAN, LESS_THAN_OR_EQUAL.
  • userId: a String value. Allowed operators are: EQUALS, NOT_EQUALS, CONTAINS, NOT_CONTAINS, STARTS_WITH, ENDS_WITH.
If you provide more than one search attribute, they are joined with an AND condition.

The orderByAttribute supports these attribute names: serialNumber, state, createDate, expiryDate, lastUsedDate, userId.
The results will only include grids that contain data in the orderByAttribute selected.

parameters.name: searchParms
parameters.description: Parameters specifying search attributes or a cursor to get results from a previous search.

post.summary: Lists a page of unassigned grids
post.description:
Returns unassigned grids for the provided search parameters. Caller requires the GRIDS:VIEW permission. The following searchByAttributes are supported:
  • serialNumber: a numeric value. Allowed operators are: EQUALS, GREATER_THAN, GREATER_THAN_OR_EQUAL, LESS_THAN, LESS_THAN_OR_EQUAL.
  • createDate: a String value representing an ISO-8601 date in UTC time (e.g., 2018-08-04T18:15:30). Allowed operators are: GREATER_THAN, GREATER_THAN_OR_EQUAL, LESS_THAN, LESS_THAN_OR_EQUAL.
If you provide more than one search attribute, they are joined with an AND condition.

The orderByAttribute supports these attribute names: serialNumber, createDate.

post.summary: Lists a page of ID Proofing requests
post.description:
Returns ID Proofing requests for the provided search parameters. Caller requires the IDPROOFING:VIEW permission. The following searchByAttributes are supported:
  • requestTime: a String value representing an ISO-8601 date in UTC time (e.g., 2018-08-04T18:15:30). Allowed operators are: GREATER_THAN, GREATER_THAN_OR_EQUAL, LESS_THAN, LESS_THAN_OR_EQUAL.
  • deviceCheckResult: a String value. Allowed operator: EQUALS. Allowed values: ALLOW, DENY, NONE, REVIEW.
  • state: a String value. Allowed operator: EQUALS. Allowed values: COMPLETE, DEVICE, IMAGE, INIT.
  • documentAuthenticationResult: a String value. Allowed operator: EQUALS. Allowed values: NONE, UNKNOWN, PASSED, FAILED, SKIPPED, ATTENTION.
  • faceMatch: true or false. Allowed operator: EQUALS.
If you provide more than one search attribute, they are joined with an AND condition.

The orderByAttribute supports these attribute names: requestTime, deviceCheckResult, state, documentAuthenticationResult, faceMatch.

post.summary: Synchronize a new user or an existing user
post.description:
Synchronize a user. Caller requires the USERS:EDIT permission. An IntelliTrust directory must be configured and associated with an Enterprise Service Gateway (ESG) 5.0 or later. If you unsynchronize a user using the unsync API, the user becomes locally managed. In order to set the user back to an AD Sync user, the user should be synchronized again using this API. Using an AD Sync crawl will only re-synchronize the user if the user is updated in AD (i.e., the user's last update time in AD is updated) or a new custom user attribute mapping is added for the directory (this resets The last update time for all users such that all AD users will be re-synchronlized).

The following response status attribute values are possible:
  • CONVERTED: the locally managed IntelliTrust user was converted into an AD Sync IntelliTrust user.
  • CREATED: a new IntelliTrust user was created as an AD Sync IntelliTrust user.
  • DELETED: the IntelliTrust user was not found in AD and has been deleted in IntelliTrust.
  • LOCALIZED_ENABLED: the IntelliTrust user was not found in AD and has been set as locally managed and enabled in IntelliTrust.
  • LOCALIZED_DISABLED: the IntelliTrust user was no found in AD and has been set as locally managed and disabled in IntelliTrust.
  • UPDATED: the AD Sync IntelliTrust user was synchronized.

parameters.name: syncUserParms
parameters.description: Parameters for synchronization.

post.description: Unsynchronize a user. Caller requires the USERS:EDIT permission. An IntelliTrust directory must be configured and associated with an Enterprise Service Gateway (ESG) 5.0 or later. If you unsynchronize a user using this API, the user becomes locally managed. In order to set the user back to an AD Sync user, the user should be synchronized again using the sync API. Using an AD Sync crawl will only re-synchronize the user if the user is updated in AD (i.e., the user's last update time in AD is updated) or a new custom user attribute mapping is added for the directory (this resets the last update time for all users such that all AD users will be re-synchronlized).

parameters.name: unsyncUserParms
parameters.description: Parameters for unsynchronization.

post.summary: Lists a page of audit events
post.description:
Returns audit events for the provided search parameters. Caller requires the REPORTS:VIEW permission.The following searchByAttributes are supported:
  • eventTime: a mandatory String value representing an ISO-8601 date in UTC time (e.g., 2018-08-04T18:15:30). Allowed operators are: GREATER_THAN, GREATER_THAN_OR_EQUAL, LESS_THAN, LESS_THAN_OR_EQUAL.
  • outcome: SUCCESS or FAIL. Allowed operator: EQUALS.
  • category: AUTHENTICATION or MANAGEMENT. Allowed operator: EQUALS.
  • entityName: a String up to 100 characters. Allowed operators: EQUALS, NOT_EQUALS, CONTAINS, NOT_CONTAINS, STARTS_WITH, ENDS_WITH.
  • entityType: a String up to 40 characters (e.g., USERS, GROUPS, QUESTIONS, REPORTS, ROLES). Allowed operators: EQUALS, NOT_EQUALS, CONTAINS, NOT_CONTAINS, STARTS_WITH, ENDS_WITH.
  • entityAction: a String up to 100 characters (e.g., ADD, EDIT, REMOVE, ASSIGN, RESET). Allowed operators: EQUALS, NOT_EQUALS, CONTAINS, NOT_CONTAINS, STARTS_WITH, ENDS_WITH.
  • resourceName: a String up to 100 characters. Allowed operators: EQUALS, NOT_EQUALS, CONTAINS, NOT_CONTAINS, STARTS_WITH, ENDS_WITH.
  • sourceIp: a String up to 39 characters. Allowed operators: EQUALS, STARTS_WITH.
  • subjectName: a String up to 100 characters (e.g., jsmith). Allowed operators: EQUALS, NOT_EQUALS, CONTAINS, NOT_CONTAINS, STARTS_WITH, ENDS_WITH.
  • eventType: a String up to 100 characters (e.g., AuthenticationDeniedEvent). Allowed operators: EQUALS, NOT_EQUALS, CONTAINS, NOT_CONTAINS, STARTS_WITH, ENDS_WITH.
  • subject: Restrict events to the UUID of a specific subject. Allowed operator: EQUALS.
If you provide more than one search attribute, they are joined with an AND condition.

The orderByAttribute supports these attribute names: eventTime, outcome, category, entityName, entityType, entityAction, resourceName, sourceIp, subjectName.
The results will only include audit events with data in the orderByAttribute selected. If ordering by entityName, entityType, or entityAction, then AUTHENTICATION events will not be returned.

parameters.name: searchParms
parameters.description: Parameters specifying search attributes or a cursor to get results from a previous search.

post.summary: Lists a page of audit events (SIEM)
post.description:
Returns audit events for the provided search parameters in ascending order always. Caller requires the REPORTS:VIEW permission.The following searchByAttributes are supported:
  • startTime: a mandatory String value representing an ISO-8601 date in UTC time (e.g., 2018-08-04T18:15:30). Allowed operators are: GREATER_THAN_OR_EQUAL.
  • endTime: a String value representing an ISO-8601 date in UTC time (e.g., 2018-08-31T18:15:30). Allowed operators are: LESS_THAN_OR_EQUAL.
  • outcome: SUCCESS or FAIL. Allowed operator: EQUALS.
  • category: AUTHENTICATION or MANAGEMENT. Allowed operator: EQUALS.
If you provide more than one search attribute, they are joined with an AND condition.

The orderByAttribute is not used even if provided. Results are returned in ascending order always (oldest to newest event)

post.description:
Returns users for the provided search parameters. Caller requires the USERS:VIEW permission. The following searchByAttributes are supported:
  • userId: a String value (it matches both the User ID or any alias). Allowed operators are: EQUALS, NOT_EQUALS, CONTAINS, NOT_CONTAINS, STARTS_WITH, ENDS_WITH.
  • groupId: a String value should be a UUID of an existing group. Allowed operator: EQUALS.
  • roleId: a String value should be a UUID of an existing role. Allowed operator: EQUALS.
  • authenticator: a String with value ENTRUST_SOFT_TOKEN or FIDO or GOOGLE_AUTHENTICATOR or GRID or HARDWARE_TOKEN or KBA or OTP or PASSWORD (IntelliTrust) or SMARTCREDENTIALPUSH or TEMP_ACCESS_CODE. Allowed operator: EQUALS, NOT_EQUALS.
  • state: ACTIVE or INACTIVE. Allowed operator: EQUALS.
  • locked: 'true' is the only value allowed. Allowed operator: EQUALS.
  • userType: a String with value LOCAL or SYNC or EXTERNAL. Allowed operator: EQUALS.
  • registrationRequired: true or false. Allowed operator: EQUALS.
If you provide more than one search attribute, they are joined with an AND condition.

The orderByAttribute supports these attribute names: userId, state.

The following attributes can be optionally included in the returned User object: grids, tokens, smartCredentials, tempAccessCode, fidoTokens, userAttributeValues, userAliases, groups

adminApiApplication.description: The parameters used to create the first Administration API application in the new tenant. If not specified, an Administration API application is not created.

CreateTenantResult.title: CreateTenantResult
CreateTenantResult.description: Information returned from a create tenant request.

error.description: If the user create failed, the error attribute will contain information about why the create failed. If the user create was successful, this value will be null.

success.description: Indicates if the user was successfully created (true) or not (false).

user.description: If the user was successfully created, the user attribute will contain information about the new user. If the user create failed, this value will be null.

CreateUserResult.title: CreateUserResult
CreateUserResult.description: When creating multiple users in a single request, the CreateUserResult value contains the result for a single user.  It will either contain information about the user created or error information describing why the create operation failed.

stopOnError.description: If set to true, the operation stops on the first operation that fails.  Otherwise the operation continues for each specified user. If not specified, this defaults to false.

users.description: The list of users to be created.

CreateUsersParms.title: CreateUsersParms
CreateUsersParms.description: When creating multiple users in a single request, the CreateUsersParms value contains the list of users to be created.

allowedDateTime.description: If true, the startDateTime and endDateTime define the allowed range. If false, the startDateTime and endDateTime define the denied range.

allowedTime.description: If true, the startTime and endTime define the allowed time range. If false, the startTime and endTime define the denied time range.

endDateTime.description: If specifying a date range, the end date of the range.

endTime.description: If specifying a time range, the end time of the range. The value should be of the form hh:mm:ss

riskPoint.description: The number of risk points that apply if this context applies.

startDateTime.description: If specifying a date range, the start date of the range.

startTime.description: If specifying a time range, the start time of the range. The value should be of the form hh:mm:ss

weekDays.description: If specifying a time range, the days of the week to which the time range will apply.

zoneId.description: The timezone offset in which dates and times are considered. For example, a value like -05:00 to specify EST.  Set the timezone value if you want to allow times 8am to 5pm in the customer's time zone and not the time zone of the service.  If not specified, the default is Z for UTC.

DateTimeContext.title: DateTimeContext
DateTimeContext.description: The DateTimeContext context specifies an allowed or disallowed date or time range. Only a date range or a time range can be specified. Risk is applied to the authentication if the current time is outside an allowed range or inside a disallowed range. A date range specifies a start and end date.  For example 2019/01/01 to 2019/03/01. A time range species a start and end time and days of the week.  For example Monday to Friday, 8am to 5pm.

id.description: The id of the user to be deleted.  The type of the id is specified by idType.

idType.description: The type of the id identifying the user.  The value can be one of UUID (the user's internal UUID), USERID (the user's userId) or EXTERNALID (the externalId of the user). If not specified, this defaults to UUID.

DeleteUserParms.title: DeleteUserParms
DeleteUserParms.description: When deleting multiple users in a single request, the DeleteUserParms value contains the id of a single user to be deleted.

error.description: If the user delete failed, the error attribute will contain information about why the delete failed. If the user update was successful, this value will be null.

success.description: Indicates if the user was successfully deleted (true) or not (false).

DeleteUserResult.title: DeleteUserResult
DeleteUserResult.description: When deleting multiple users in a single request, the DeleteUserResult value contains the result for a single user.  It will indicate if the operation succeeded and if it failed will include error information describing why the  operation failed.

stopOnError.description: If set to true, the operation stops on the first operation that fails.  Otherwise the operation continues for each specified user. If not specified, this defaults to false.

users.description: The list of users to be deleted.

DeleteUsersParms.title: DeleteUsersParms
DeleteUsersParms.description: When deleting multiple users in a single request, the DeleteUsersParms value contains the list of users to be deleted.

activationTypes.description: The list of activation types that will be performed.  Allowed values are: CLASSIC (return activation values that must be manually entered into the mobile application), ONLINE (return a link that when clicked will launch the mobile application) and OFFLINE (return a QR code that can be scanned by the mobile application).  If no values are specified in the list then activation types are not updated.

allowUnsecureDevice.description: A flag indicating if the Mobile soft token can be activated on a rooted device. Default is false.

onlineActivationPasswordLength.description: The length of the random password generated for an online activation. Default is 16.

otpLength.description: The length of the OTP generated by the soft token. The default is 8.

pinRequired.description: A flag indicating if this token requires that a PIN be enabled on the Entrust Soft Token application. The default is true.

scheme.description: Specifies the URL scheme used in soft token activation URLs. It should specify the URL scheme associated with the mobile application to be used. This value should only be changed if you are using your own mobile application written using the Entrust ST SDK.  The default value is igmobileotp which corresponds to the Entrust ST application.

authenticationSessionLifetime.description: The amount of time in seconds before an authenticated user needs to re-authenticate. Default is 900.

defaultMobileSmartCredential.description: A flag that indicates whether to automatically enroll a smart credential for the user when it is created. Default is false.

defaultPassword.description: A flag that indicates if a default password is created for the user when it is created. Default is true.

dynamicLinkingTransactionLifetime.description: The amount of time in seconds before a dynamic linking transaction expired. Default is 300.

lockoutCount.description: The number of failed authentications before a user is locked out. Default is 5.

lockoutLifetime.description: The amount of time in seconds before a user lockout expires.  A value of 0 means the lockout never expires. Minimum is 0. Default is 0.

maxFIDOTokensPerUser.description: The maximum number of FIDO tokens that a user can have.  Default is 5.

maxGridsPerUser.description: The maximum number of grids that a user can have.  Default is 5.

maxSmartCredentialsPerUser.description: The maximum number of smart credentials that a user can have.  Default is 3.

maxTokensPerUser.description: The maximum number of tokens that a user can have.  Default is 5.

pushAuthenticationLifetime.description: The amount of time in seconds before a push authentication requires expires if a response is not received from the mobile application.  Default is 300.

registrationPeriod.description: The user registration period in days. Default is 0. Deprecated: use the SelfServiceSettings registrationEnabled attribute.

actions.example: The expiration date on the document may have been misread.  Confirm that it is legible and occurs on or after the current date. Also confirm that the current date and time of the host computer is correctly set.
actions.description: A longer description with possible actions to performed on the document.

description.example: Checked if the document is expired.
description.description: The description of the check performed on the document.

disposition.description: A short description with result of the check performed on the document.

information.example: Verified that the birth date is valid, in the expected format, and occurs on or before the current date and not outside a reasonable range.

ImmutableIdProofingDocumentTestResult.title: ImmutableIdProofingDocumentTestResult
ImmutableIdProofingDocumentTestResult.description: Information about an individual test result.

allowedIpRanges.description: List of IP Address ranges (in CIDR notation) that are allowed access the resource. Risk applies if the given IP address is not in one of the allowed IP ranges. If specified, the allowed IP values take precedence over the denied IP values.

deniedIpRanges.description: List of IP Address ranges (in CIDR notation) that cannot access the resource. Risk applies if the given IP address is in one of the denied IP ranges. The denied IP values are ignored if allowed IP ranges are specified.

riskPoint.description: The number of risk points that apply if this context applies.

IpContext.title: IpContext
IpContext.description: The IP context specifies allowed or denied IP address ranges. Risk is applied to the authentication if the current IP address does not match an allowed IP address range or does match a denied IP address range.

cityName.description: The city name--always returned in upper-case.

isp.description: The ISP name--always returned in upper-case.

privateIpAddress.description: Whether the IP provided is a private IP Address.  The value is only available when resolving an IP address to an IpLocation.

IpLocation.title: IpLocation
IpLocation.description: Information describing the location of an IP address.

challengeSize.description: Number of questions that the user must answer. If not provided, the default QA challenge size in the KBA settings is used.

wrongAnswersAllowed.description: Number of questions that the user could answer incorrectly and still be considered a valid response. If not provided, the default wrong answers allowed in the KBA settings is used.

KbaContext.title: KbaContext
KbaContext.description: The KBA context allows the settings for knowledge-based authentication to be overridden for a particular resource rule.  For example, a different challenge size can be specified.

maximumNumberOfQuestions.description: The maximum number of questions a user can answer for KBA. If zero, then KBA is disabled. This value is not used when adding or updating a KBA. If provided, it will be ignored.

maximumResponseSize.description: The maximum number of characters in an answer. This value is not used when adding or updating a KBA. If provided, it will be ignored.

minimumNumberOfQuestions.description: The minimum number of questions a user must answer to perform KBA. Defaults to the maximum Q&A challenge size setting. This value is not used when adding or updating a KBA. If provided, it will be ignored.

userQuestions.description: The list of question/answer pairs stored for a user. This is the only attribute required when adding or updating a KBA.

KnowledgeBasedAuthenticator.title: KnowledgeBasedAuthenticator
KnowledgeBasedAuthenticator.description: KBA information stored for a user.

allowed.description: If true, the list of countries defines allowed countries. If false, the list of countries defines denied countries.

countryCodes.description: List of country codes (ISO alpha-2) that can access(allowed=true) or not access (allowed=false).

riskPoint.description: The number of risk points that apply if this context applies.

LocationContext.title: LocationContext
LocationContext.description: The location context specifies allowed or denied country codes. Risk is applied to the authentication if the location of the current IP address does not match an allowed country or matches a disallowed country.

riskPoint.description: The number of risk points that apply if this context applies.

LocationHistoryContext.title: LocationHistoryContext
LocationHistoryContext.description: Location history checks to see if the location of the current IP address matches a location from a previous authentication. If the current location does not match history, risk is applied.

riskLimit.description: The risk points apply if the machine authenticator risk is below or equal to this value.

riskPoint.description: The number of risk points that apply if this context applies.

MachineContext.title: MachineContext
MachineContext.description: Represents a Machine Authenticator authentication context. When defined, a Machine Authentication authenticator is expected in the  authentication request. Risk will apply if the machine authentication authenticator is not present or if the risk for the machine authentication authentication is greater than the risk limit define for the Machine context.

ModifiedEntityAttribute.description: Information about an attribute that was modified for an entity.

otpAlphabet.description: Characters that can appear in a RANDOM OTP. Can contain any non-whitespace character. Default is all digits.

otpDefaultDelivery.description: The default OTP delivery mechanism.  Choices are EMAIL, SMS, or VOICE.  Default is SMS.

otpLength.description: The length of an OTP. Default is 8.

otpLifetime.description: The lifetime of an OTP in seconds. Default is 300.

otpType.description: The type of OTP generated.  Choices are RANDOM or MEMO_PASSCODE. Default is RANDOM

OTPAuthenticatorSettings.description: Settings that control the behavior of OTP authentication.

protectedOfflineOTPMaxClients.description: Maximum number of IntelliTrust Desktops (or clients in general) that are allowed to be registered with a token for downloading OTPs.

protectedOfflineOTPMaxRefill.description: Maximum number of hours' worth of offline OTPs that a client is allowed to possess.

protectedOfflineOTPMinorRefill.description: Default number of hours' worth of offline OTPs that is returned.

protectedOfflineOTPProtection.description: This controls the length of the private salt and is measured in bits. The values map as follows: Normal = 14, Strong = 17, and Very Strong = 20

protectedOfflineOTPSupport.description: Defines whether tokens can be used offline.

ProtectedOfflineSettings.description: Offline token settings to support offline token feature only for IntelliTrust Desktop Application.

dateTimeContext.description: The date time context specifies an allowed or disallowed date or time range. Risk is applied to the authentication if the current time is outside an allowed range or inside a disallowed range.

description.description: The description of the resource rule.

disableSSO.description: A flag indicating if single-sign on is disabled for this resource rule.

enabled.description: A flag indicating if this resource rule is enabled or not.  Only enabled resource rules are considered during authentication.

groups.description: The groups associated with this resource rule. The resource rule only applies to users in one of the specified groups. A resource rule must specify at least one group which can be the default All Groups if you want the resource rule to apply to all users.

highRiskFirstStep.description: The authenticator type to use in the first step of a two-step authentication scenario when the risk score is High.

highRiskSecondStep.description: The authenticator type to use during in the second step of a two-step authentication scenario when the risk score is High.

id.description: The unique UUID assigned to the resource rule when it is created.

ipContext.description: The IP context specifies allowed or denied IP address ranges. Risk is applied to the authentication if the current IP address does not match an allowed IP address range or does match a denied IP address range.

kbaContext.description: The KBA context allows the settings for knowledge-based authentication to be overridden for a particular resource rule.

locationContext.description: The location context specifies allowed or denied country codes. Risk is applied to the authentication if the location of the current IP address does not match an allowed country or matches a disallowed country.

locationHistoryContext.description: Location history checks to see if the location of the current IP address matches a location from a previous authentication. If the current location does not match history, risk is applied.

lowRiskFirstStep.description: The authenticator type to use in the first step of a two-step authentication scenario when the risk score is Low.

lowRiskSecondStep.description: The authenticator type to use during in the second step of a two-step authentication scenario when the risk score is Low.

lowRiskThreshold.description: Risk scores below this value are considered Low risk.

machineContext.description: If machine authentication is performed during an authentication request, the machine context specifies the level at which risk is applied to the authentication request.

mediumRiskFirstStep.description: The authenticator type to use in the first step of a two-step authentication scenario when the risk score is Medium.

mediumRiskSecondStep.description: The authenticator type to use during in the second step of a two-step authentication scenario when the risk score is Medium.

mediumRiskThreshold.description: Risk scores below this value are considered Medium risk. Risk scores equal or greater than this value are considered High risk.

name.description: The name of the resource rule.

resourceId.description: The UUID of the resource to which this resource rule is assigned.

resourceName.description: The name of the resource to which this resource rule is assigned.

systemResourceContext.description: A flag indicating if this resource rule is associated with a system resource including the Admin and User portals. A resource rule for a system resource cannot be deleted.  They can only be disabled if there is at least one enabled resource rule for the resource.

travelVelocityContext.description: Travel velocity checks to see if the time between authentications at different locations means the user has traveled faster than a given velocity. If the velocity is exceeded, risk applies.

ResourceRule.title: ResourceRule
ResourceRule.description: A ResourceRule defines the information returned from IntelliTrust about a resource rule. A resource rule is used to determine what authentication is used to authenticate to the specified resource (aka application).

dateTimeContext.description: The date time context specifies an allowed or disallowed date or time range. Risk is applied to the authentication if the current time is outside an allowed range or inside a disallowed range.

description.description: The description of the resource rule.

disableSSO.description: A flag indicating if single-sign on is disabled for this resource rule.

enabled.description: A flag indicating if this resource rule is enabled or not.  Only enabled resource rules are considered during authentication.

groupIds.description: The UUIDs of groups associated with this resource rule. The resource rule will only apply to users in one of the specified groups. When creating a resource rule, if no groupsIds are specified, the resource rule will apply to all users.

groups.description: The groups associated with this resource rule. The resource rule only applies to users in one of the specified groups. If no groups are specified, the resource rule applies to all users.  This attribute is ignored if the groupIds attribute is specified. The groupIds attribute should be used instead.

highRiskFirstStep.description: The authenticator type to use in the first step of a two-step authentication scenario when the risk score is High. Only the values NONE, EXTERNAL, PASSWORD or DENY should be used for highRiskFirstStep. Other values are defined for backwards compatibility. Some values are not supported by all application types.

highRiskSecondStep.description: The authenticator type to use during in the second step of a two-step authentication scenario when the risk score is High. Some values are not supported by all application types.

ipContext.description: The IP context specifies allowed or denied IP address ranges. Risk is applied to the authentication if the current IP address does not match an allowed IP address range or does match a denied IP address range.

kbaContext.description: The KBA context allows the settings for knowledge-based authentication to be overridden for a particular resource rule.

locationContext.description: The location context specifies allowed or denied country codes. Risk is applied to the authentication if the location of the current IP address does not match an allowed country or matches a disallowed country.

locationHistoryContext.description: Location history checks to see if the location of the current IP address matches a location from a previous authentication. If the current location does not match history, risk is applied.

lowRiskFirstStep.description: The authenticator type to use in the first step of a two-step authentication scenario when the risk score is Low.  Only the values NONE, EXTERNAL, PASSWORD should be used for lowRiskFirstStep.  The value DENY can only by specified for medium or hight risk values.  Other values are defined for backwards compatibility. Some values are not supported by all application types.

lowRiskSecondStep.description: The authenticator type to use during in the second step of a two-step authentication scenario when the risk score is Low. Some values are not supported by all application types.

lowRiskThreshold.description: Risk scores below this value are considered Low risk.

machineContext.description: If machine authentication is performed during an authentication request, the machine context specifies the level at which risk is applied to the authentication request.

mediumRiskFirstStep.description: The authenticator type to use in the first step of a two-step authentication scenario when the risk score is Medium. Only the values NONE, EXTERNAL, PASSWORD or DENY should be used for mediumRiskFirstStep. Other values are defined for backwards compatibility.  Some values are not supported by all application types..

mediumRiskSecondStep.description: The authenticator type to use during in the second step of a two-step authentication scenario when the risk score is Medium. Some values are not supported by all application types.

mediumRiskThreshold.description: Risk scores below this value are considered Medium risk. Risk scores equal or greater than this value are considered High risk.

name.description: The name of the resource rule.

removeDateTimeContext.description: When updating a resource rule, if removeDateTimeContext is set to true, the existing date time context is removed. This attribute is ignored when creating a resource rule and when updating a resource rule if dateTimeContext is specified.

removeIPContext.description: When updating a resource rule, if removeIPContext is set to true, the existing IP context is removed. This attribute is ignored when creating a resource rule and when updating a resource rule if ipContext is specified.

removeKBAContext.description: When updating a resource rule, if removeKBAContext is set to true, the existing KBA context is removed. This attribute is ignored when creating a resource rule and when updating a resource rule if kbaContext is specified.

removeLocationContext.description: When updating a resource rule, if removeLocationContext is set to true, the existing location context is removed. This attribute is ignored when creating a resource rule and when updating a resource rule if locationContext is specified.

removeLocationHistoryContext.description: When updating a resource rule, if removeLocationHistoryContext is set to true, the existing location history context is removed. This attribute is ignored when creating a resource rule and when updating a resource rule if locationHistoryContext is specified.

removeMachineContext.description: When updating a resource rule, if removeMachineContext is set to true, the existing machine context is removed. This attribute is ignored when creating a resource rule and when updating a resource rule if machineContext is specified.

removeTravelVelocityContext.description: When updating a resource rule, if removeTravelVelocityContext is set to true, the existing travel velocity context is removed. This attribute is ignored when creating a resource rule and when updating a resource rule if travelVelocityContext is specified.

resourceId.description: The UUID of the resource to which this resource rule is assigned. This value is only used when creating a resource rule.

travelVelocityContext.description: Travel velocity checks to see if the time between authentications at different locations means the user has traveled faster than a given velocity. If the velocity is exceeded, risk applies.

ResourceRuleParms.title: ResourceRuleParms
ResourceRuleParms.description: A ResourceRuleParms defines the information passed to IntelliTrust when created or modifying a resource rule. A resource rule is used to determine what authentication is used to authenticate to the specified resource (aka application).

usersInRole.description: The number of users in this role.

lifetime.description: The lifetime of smart credentials created for this SC Defn.

A child of a non-root service provider inherits the value of its service provider and if specified, this value is ignored.

companyCountry.description: The country two-letter code (ISO 3166-1) of the location of the company that will own this account.  This value is required

companyState.description: The province/state two-letter code (postal abbreviation) of the location of the company that will own this account.  This value is required for companies in the United States or Canada.

domain.description: The domain for this account. This value is required when creating a tenant

issuanceAccount.description: When creating a new tenant as a child of the root service provider set this to true if the tenant is to be an issuance service. If not specified, it defaults to false. You cannot set the authenticate and issuance values to both true or both false. A child of a non-root service provider inherits the value of its service provider and if specified, this value is ignored.

registeredForTransactions.description: A flag indicating if the Entrust Soft Token has registered for transactions. Only tokens that are registered can perform token push authentication.

serialNumber.description: The serial number of the token either generated when the token was created or loaded into the system.

state.description: The state of the token.  For most tokens, only tokens in the ACTIVE state can be used for authentication. Google Authenticator tokens in the ACTIVATING state can also be used for authentication.

supportsChallengeResponse.description: A flag indicating if the Token supports challenge response processing.

supportsResponse.description: A flag indicating if the Token supports response processing.

supportsSignature.description: A flag indicating if the Token supports signature processing.

supportsUnlock.description: A flag indicating if the Token supports unlock processing.

supportsUnlockTOTP.description: A flag indicating if the Token supports unlock using TOTP processing.

type.description: The type of token specified when the token was created or loaded into the system.

Token.title: Token
Token.description: Information returned from the service about a token.

activateParms.description: If specified, token activation is performed with these parameters.  If not specified, the token is not activated.

TokenCreateParms.title: TokenCreateParms
TokenCreateParms.description: Optional parameters passed to the token create operation.

results.description: A single page with the list of assigned tokens found.

TokensPage.title: TokensPage
TokensPage.description: Contains paging information and the results from an assigned tokens search.

riskPoint.description: The number of risk points that apply if this context applies.

TravelVelocityContext.title: TravelVelocityContext
TravelVelocityContext.description: Travel velocity checks to see if the time between authentications at different locations means the user has traveled faster than a given velocity. If the velocity is exceeded, risk applies.

unlockChallenge.description: The unlock challenge generated by the token when it is locked.

UnlockParms.title: UnlockParms
UnlockParms.description: Parameters passed to the token unlock operation.

unlockCode.description: The unlock code generated by the service in response to the unlock challenge. This value should be entered into the token to complete the unlock.

UnlockResult.title: UnlockResult
UnlockResult.description: The response returned from a token unlock operation.

id.description: The id of the user to be unsynchronized.  The type of the id is specified by idType.

idType.description: The type of the id identifying the user.  The value can be one of UUID (the user's internal UUID) or USERID (the user's userId). The value of EXTERNALID  is currently not supported.  If not specified, this defaults to USERID.

UnsyncUserParms.title: UnsyncUserParms
UnsyncUserParms.description: Parameters passed when unsynchronnizing a user.

id.description: The id of the user to be updated.  The type of the id is specified by idType.

idType.description: The type of the id identifying the user.  The value can be one of UUID (the user's internal UUID), USERID (the user's userId) or EXTERNALID (the externalId of the user). If not specified, this defaults to UUID.

parms.description: The parameters to be changed for the user.

UpdateUserParms.title: UpdateUserParms
UpdateUserParms.description: When updating multiple users in a single request, the UpdateUserParms value contains the update parameters for a single user.  It will include the id of the user to be updated and the parameters to be changed for that user.

error.description: If the user update failed, the error attribute will contain information about why the update failed. If the user update was successful, this value will be null.

success.description: Indicates if the user was successfully updated (true) or not (false).

UpdateUserResult.title: UpdateUserResult
UpdateUserResult.description: When updating multiple users in a single request, the UpdateUserResult value contains the result for a single user.  It will indicate if the operation succeeded and if it failed will include error information describing why the  operation failed.

stopOnError.description: If set to true, the operation stops on the first operation that fails.  Otherwise the operation continues for each specified user. If not specified, this defaults to false.

users.description: The list of users to be updated.

UpdateUsersParms.title: UpdateUsersParms
UpdateUsersParms.description: When updating multiple users in a single request, the UpdateUsersParms value contains the list of users to be updated.

directoryDN.description: The DN of the user in the directory the user was synchronized from.

directoryId.description: If the user was synchronized from a directory, the UUID of that directory.

directoryName.description: If the user was synchronized from a directory, the name of that directory.

directoryObjectGUID.description: The objectGUID of the user in the directory the user was synchronized from.

email.description: The email address of this user.  This value may or may not be required depending on configuration. It must be set to use EMAIL OTP authentication and other features that require an email address.

externalId.description: An optional external Id for this user.  This value can be used to track the external identity of an IntelliTrust user.

externalSource.description: An optional value that describes the source when the user is synchronized from an external source.

fidoTokens.description: A list of all the FIDO tokens owned by this user.

firstName.description: The first name of this user.  This value may or may not be required depending on configuration.

grids.description: A list of all the grids owned by this user.

groups.description: A list of all groups to which this user belongs.

id.description: The unique UUID for this user.  This value is generated by the service when a user is created.

lastName.description: The last name of this user.  This value may or may not be required depending on configuration.

locale.description: The locale of this user.  If not set, the default account locale will be used.

locked.description: A flag indicating if this user is locked.

lockedAuthenticatorTypes.description: The user authenticators that are locked.

lockedAuthenticators.description: The user authenticators that are locked. Deprecated: use lockedAuthenticatorTypes

lockoutExpiry.description: If the user is locked, this value will specify the time at which the lockout will expire.

migrated.description: A flag indicating if this user was migrated from Entrust IdentityGuard.

mobile.description: The mobile number of this user.  This value may or may not be required depending on configuration. It must be set to use SMS OTP authentication.

otpCreateTime.description: If the user has an OTP, this attribute specifies when the user's OTP was created.

phone.description: The phone number of this user.  This value may or may not be required depending on configuration. It must be set to use VOICE OTP authentication.

registrationRequired.description: Indicates whether self-registration is required. This attribute doesn't apply to administrators.

smartCredentials.description: A list of all the smart credentials owned by this user.

state.description: The state of this user.  Only users in the ACTIVE state can perform authentication.

tempAccessCode.description: The temporary access code of this user if the user has one.

tokens.description: A list of all the tokens owned by this user.

type.description: The type of user.  A value of LDAP_AD means the user was synchronized from a directory. A value of MGMT_UI means the user was created in IntelliTrust. A value of EXTERNAL means the user was synchronized from an external source.

userAliases.description: A list of user aliases for this user.

userAttributeValues.description: A list of user attribute values for this user.

userId.description: The user Id for this user.

User.title: User
User.description: The values stored for a user.  This structure is passed when creating or modifying a user.  It is returned when querying a user.

id.description: The UUID of this user alias set when the user alias is created.

type.description: The type of user alias. A value of USERID is used for an alias that will represent the actual user id value. A value of CUSTOM is used for aliases manually created by an administrator.  A value of DERIVED is defined for future use and should not be used at this time.

userId.description: The UUID of the user to which this user alias belongs.

value.description: The value for the user alias.

UserAlias.title: UserAlias
UserAlias.description: Specifies an alias for a particular user.

id.description: The UUID for this user attribute.  Generated when the user attribute is created.

mandatory.description: A flag indicating if users must have a value for this user attribute.

name.description: The name of this user attribute.

systemDefined.description: A flag indicating if this user attribute is one of the system defined user attributes.

unique.description: A flag indicating if this attribute is intended to be unique.

mandatory.description: A flag indicating if users must have a value for this user attribute. If not specified when creating a user attribute if defaults to false.

name.description: The name of this user attribute. This must be specified when creating a user attribute.

unique.description: A flag indicating if this attribute is intended to be unique. If not specified when creating a user attribute it defaults to false.

UserAttributeParms.title: UserAttributeParms
UserAttributeParms.description: Information about user attribute definitions passed when creating or modifying a user attribute.

editable.description: A flag indicating if this user attribute value can be modified.

id.description: The UUID of this user attribute value set when the user attribute value is created.

lastUpdate.description: The last time the attribute value was updated.

userAttribute.description: The full details of the user attribute that defines this user attribute value.  This attribute is provided when a user attribute value is retrieved from the service.  It does not need to be set when creating or modifying a value.

userAttributeId.description: The UUID of the user attribute that defines this user attribute value.  The userAttributeId must be provided when creating or modifying a user attribute value.

userId.description: The UUID of the user to which this user attribute value belongs.

value.description: The value for the user attribute.

UserAttributeValue.title: UserAttributeValue
UserAttributeValue.description: Specifies the value of a user attribute for a particular user.

state.description: The new state of the user.

UserChangeStateParms.title: UserChangeStateParms
UserChangeStateParms.description: Parameters passed to the user change state operation.

expectedLocations.description: The list of expected locations stored for this user.

maximumExpectedLocations.description: The maximum number of expected locations that can be stored for this user.

UserExpectedLocations.title: UserExpectedLocations
UserExpectedLocations.description: Information about the expected locations stored for a user.

userId.description: If fetching a user by userId or alias, this value specifies, the userId or user alias of the user to be fetched. If fetching a user by externalId, this value specifies, the externalId of the user to be fetched.

UserGetParms.title: UserGetParms
UserGetParms.description: Parameters passed to get a user by user id, user alias or externalId.

city.description: The city name--always returned in upper-case.

id.description: The UUID of the user location.

isp.description: The ISP name--always returned in upper-case.

lastAuthenticationTime.description: The time of the last authentication from this location.

numberOfAuthentications.description: The number of times this location was used during authentication.

privateIpAddress.description: Whether the IP provided is a private IP Address.

UserLocation.title: UserLocation
UserLocation.description: Information stored describing a user location.

expiryTime.description: When this machine secret expires in UTC time

id.description: Identifies the device/machine

label.description: Identifies the device/machine from the end-user point of view

lastUsedTime.description: When this machine secret was last used

registrationTime.description: When this machine secret was created in UTC time

email.description: The email address of this user.  This value may or may not be required depending on configuration.  If it is required, it must be specified when creating the user.  If it is required, it must be specified when updating the user and a value is not currently set.  It must be set to use EMAIL OTP authentication and other features that require an email address.  To remove the existing value, set the value to an empty string.

externalId.description: An optional external Id for this user.  This value can be used to track the external identity of an IntelliTrust user. To unset the external Id, specify an empty string.

externalSource.description: An optional value that describes the source when the user is synchronized from an external source. To unset the external source, specify an empty string.

firstName.description: The first name of this user.  This value may or may not be required depending on configuration.  If it is required, it must be specified when creating the user.  If it is required, it must be specified when updating the user and a value is not currently set.  To remove the existing value, set the value to an empty string.

groups.description: A list of group UUIDs to be assigned to this user.  If specified, these groups replace existing groups.

lastName.description: The last name of this user.    This value may or may not be required depending on configuration.  If it is required, it must be specified when creating the user.  If it is required, it must be specified when updating the user and a value is not currently set.  To remove the existing value, set the value to an empty string.

locale.description: The locale of this user.  If not set, the default account locale will be used. To remove the existing value, set the value to an empty string.

mobile.description: The mobile number of this user.  This value may or may not be required depending on configuration.  If it is required, it must be specified when creating the user.  If it is required, it must be specified when updating the user and a value is not currently set.  It must be set to use SMS OTP authentication.  To remove the existing value, set the value to an empty string.

phone.description: The phone number of this user.  This value may or may not be required depending on configuration.  If it is required, it must be specified when creating the user.  If it is required, it must be specified when updating the user and a value is not currently set.  It must be set to use VOICE OTP authentication.  To remove the existing value, set the value to an empty string.

registrationRequired.description: Indicates whether self-registration is required. If not set when the user is created, this value defaults to true.

state.description: The state of this user.  Only users in the ACTIVE state can perform authentication. If not set when the user is created, this value defaults to ACTIVE.

userAliases.description: A list of user aliases for this user. Alias values must be unique with respect to the userId and other aliases of this user and other users.

userAttributeValues.description: A list of user attribute values for this user.

userId.description: The user Id for this user.  This value is required when creating the user, optional during update. The userId must be unique with respect to aliases of this user and the userId and aliases of all other users.

UserParms.title: UserParms
UserParms.description: Parameters passed when creating or modifying a user.

expiryTime.description: The date at which the password will expire.

forceUpdate.description: Indicates if the user will be forced to change their password the next time the user authenticates with it.

lastChangedTime.description: The last time the password was changed.

present.description: A flag that indicates if the user has a password.

UserPassword.title: UserPassword
UserPassword.description: Information returned when a user password is queried.

clearPasswordHistory.description: If set to true, this flag indicates existing password history is cleared before the new password is created.

currentPassword.description: A value for the current password when changing the AD-User password.

emailPassword.description: A flag indicating whether to email a new password to the user.  It defaults to true.

expiryTime.description: The date at which the password will expire.

forceUpdate.description: If set to true, this value indicates the user will be forced to change their password upon next password authentication.

generatePassword.description: A flag indicating whether a new random password is generated. It defaults to false.

password.description: A value for the new password when setting the user password. This value is ignored if generatePassword is set to true.

UserPasswordParms.title: UserPasswordParms
UserPasswordParms.description: Information passed when creating or modifying a user's password.

suggestions.description: Suggestions on how the password strength can be improved.

ignorePasswordHistory.description: If set to true, existing password history is ignored.

password.description: New password value that needs to be validated.

adComplexity.description: True if password meets the active directory complexity requirements.

alias.description: True if password meets the userId requirements. Password must not contain user alias.

alphaNumeric.description: True if password meets the alpha numeric requirements.

blacklisted.description: True if password does not contain a blacklisted password.

fullName.description: True if password meets the full name requirements. Full Name must not be in the password.

length.description: True if password meets the length requirements.

lowerCase.description: True if password meets the lower case requirements.

nondeterministicValidations.description: List of validations that cannot be determined mostly due to user is AD managed.

numeric.description: True if password meets the numeric requirements.

passwordHistory.description: True if password does not match the history if enabled.

repeatedCharacters.description: True if password meets the repeated characters requirements.

strength.description: True if password meets the minimum strength requirements.

upperCase.description: True if password meets the upper case requirements.

userID.description: True if password meets the userId requirements. Password must not contain userId.

userPasswordStrength.description: Password strength object which contains score and suggestions.

id.description: The UUID of the KBA question/answer.

UserQuestion.title: UserQuestion
UserQuestion.description: A KBA question/answer stored for a user.

locationHistoryIpCheckRequired.description: A flag indicating if the IP address is considered when checking to see if two locations are the same.

maximumLocationHistory.description: The maximum number of user locations stored in location history.

velocityCheckRequired.description: A flag indicating if a velocity check is performed when checking the current location against location history.

UserRbaSettings.title: UserRbaSettings
UserRbaSettings.description: RBA settings that can be set on a per user basis.

results.description: A single page with the list of users found.

UsersPage.title: UsersPage
UsersPage.description: Contains paging information and the results from a user search.
